channel.title: Server Run Help (very descriptive)
channel.description:
Hey, To start off I am using windows vista, I have Jdk and Jre (the newest ones). When I run my server I get a message that says 'java' is not recognized as an internal or external command. this is the code I am using now to run it
[code]@echo off title Running... java -cp .;./jython.jar server[/code]
and if this helps this is my Classpath [code]CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_18\bin;%CLASSPATH%;[/code]
and this is my Path [code]C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_18\bin;[/code]
Please help! thank ya!

item.title: Server Run Help (very descriptive)
item.dc:creator: @tman915 tman915
item.description:
@tman915 wrote:

it didn’t work

Read full topic

item.title: Server Run Help (very descriptive)
item.dc:creator: @MoparScaperDude MoparScaperDude
item.description:
@MoparScaperDude wrote:

Path in the environment variables?

Try removing the “;” in path.

Just checked, and I don’t have one :S

Read full topic

item.title: Server Run Help (very descriptive)
item.dc:creator: @SirPali SirPali
item.description:
@SirPali wrote:

Are you running the command promt in Administrator mode? Friend of mine had same problem, fixed it bu running the commandpromt in admin mode.

Read full topic

item.description:
@tman915 wrote:

Hey,
To start off I am using windows vista,
I have Jdk and Jre (the newest ones).
When I run my server I get a message that says ‘java’ is not recognized as an internal or external command.
this is the code I am using now to run it

@echo off title Running... java -cp .;./jython.jar server

and if this helps this is my Classpath

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_18\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

and this is my Path

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_18\bin;
